snippet: As the deadline approaches, states are deciding whether they will run their own exchanges..
abstract: Editorial criticizes governors of twenty-three states that have declared they will not set up their own health insurance exchanges, as required by health care reform law, to help individuals and small businesses find affordable health coverage; contends that even though exchanges will be set up by federal government, it would be best if states took on job.
lead_paragraph: As the deadline approaches, states are deciding whether they will run their own exchanges..

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
